description: Composition refers to the arrangement and organization of different components within a whole. In various fields, it denotes how elements combine to form a complete entity, impacting functionality, aesthetics, and meaning.

common_types.name: Statistical Composition
common_types.description: The way in which various parts of a dataset contribute to the overall statistics. This includes the distribution and proportion of different categories.

common_types.name: Musical Composition
common_types.description: The art of creating a piece of music by combining various musical elements such as melody, harmony, rhythm, and dynamics.

common_types.name: Visual Composition
common_types.description: In art and design, it refers to how visual elements (lines, shapes, colors) are arranged to create a cohesive and aesthetically pleasing piece.

common_types.name: Textual Composition
common_types.description: The organization of ideas and elements in writing, which includes the structure, style, and flow of content.

visualization_techniques.description: Represents the composition of a whole by showing the relative sizes of different parts, useful for displaying percentage distributions.
Compares different categories by showing the size of each category's value, allowing for an easy visual comparison.
Shows the composition of several variables over time, highlighting the contribution of each component to the total.
Illustrates the relationships and overlaps between different sets, useful for showing how components share commonalities.

applications: Understanding the parts that make up a whole in statistical analysis.
Creating harmonious and effective musical pieces in composition studies.
Enhancing visual communication in design and art.
Improving the clarity and effectiveness of written communication.
